snippet: Russian officials have said previously that the antimissile sites could become targets in the event of war, but the threat of a pre-emptive attack on sites in Eastern Europe was new.
abstract: Senior Russian general Nikolai Makarov, in speech at conference in Moscow, threatens pre-emptive attacks on missile-defense sites in Poland and elsewhere in Eastern Europe in the event of a crisis; remarks come as Vladimir Putin prepares to assume the presidency and might signal a move to a more muscular foreign policy.
lead_paragraph: Russian officials have said previously that the antimissile sites could become targets in the event of war, but the threat of a pre-emptive attack on sites in Eastern Europe was new.

headline.main: Russian General Makes Threat on Missile-Defense Sites
headline.print_headline: Russian General Makes Threat on Missile-Defense Sites
